t: For the director of music. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” A psalm of Asaph. A song.
We*pn praise you, God, we*ld praise you, for your Name is near; people*ld tell of your wonderful deeds.
You*pn say, “I choose the appointed time; it*ld is I who judge with equity.
When*ln the earth and all its people quake, it*ld is I who hold its pillars firm.
To*ln the arrogant I say, ‘Boast no more,’ and*ld to the wicked, ‘Do not lift up your horns.
Do*ln not lift your horns against heaven; do*ld not speak so defiantly.’ ”
No*pn one from the east or the west or*ld from the desert can exalt themselves.
It*ln is God who judges: He*ld brings one down, he exalts another.
In*ln the hand of the Lord*s is a cup full*ld of foaming wine mixed with spices; he*ln pours it out, and all the wicked of the earth drink*ld it down to its very dregs.
As*pn for me, I will declare this forever; I*ld will sing praise to the God of Jacob,
who*ln says, “I will cut off the horns of all the wicked, but*ld the horns of the righteous will be lifted up.”
